properties.headline: Flood Warning issued March 2 at 10:12AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...Kentucky...Missouri...

Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam and Cairo

.The recent and forecast rainfall that has fallen over part of the
Ohio and Tennessee River Valleys will work to slow the fall of water
levels on the Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam and at Cairo. Both
locations are not expected to fall below flood stage until the latter
half of this week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam
* until Wednesday night, March 4th
* At  9:00 AM Monday the stage was 38.6 feet.
* Flood Stage is 36.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The River will continue to fall to a stage of 37.6 feet
by tomorrow morning and fall below flood stage around midnight on
Wednesday, March 4th.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
